title: Prohibits discrimination in promotion of police officers who fail to meet their employer's ticket quotas
summary: Prohibits discrimination in the promotion of police officers who fail to meet their employer's traffic ticket quota.
fulltext:
S T A T E   O F   N E W   Y O R K
       ________________________________________________________________________

                                         3205

                              2011-2012 Regular Sessions

                                 I N  A S S E M B L Y

                                   January 24, 2011
                                      ___________

       Introduced  by M. of A. PRETLOW -- read once and referred to the Commit-
         tee on Labor

       AN ACT to amend the labor law, in  relation  to  discrimination  against
         employees for failure to meet certain ticket quotas

         THE  PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section 1. Section 215-a of the labor law is amended by adding  a  new
    2  subdivision 3 to read as follows:
    3    3.  FOR  THE  PURPOSE  OF  THIS SECTION AN EMPLOYER OR HIS OR HER DULY
    4  AUTHORIZED AGENT WHO DENIES A PROMOTION TO AN  EMPLOYEE  SOLELY  BECAUSE
    5  SUCH EMPLOYEE HAS FAILED TO MEET AN ESTABLISHED QUOTA SHALL BE DEEMED TO
    6  HAVE PENALIZED SUCH EMPLOYEE AS TO HIS OR HER EMPLOYMENT.
    7    S 2. This act shall take effect immediately; provided however that the
    8  amendment  to section 215-a of the labor law made by section one of this
    9  act shall survive the  expiration  and  reversion  of  such  section  as
   10  provided in subdivision (p) of section 406 of chapter 166 of the laws of
   11  1991, as amended.





        EXPLANATION--Matter in ITALICS (underscored) is new; matter in brackets
                             [ ] is old law to be omitted.
